Package sample.JavaFX.SearchImageScene

Class SearchImageSceneController

java.lang.Object
sample.JavaFX.SearchImageScene.SearchImageSceneController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class SearchImageSceneController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
SearchImageSceneController controls the SearchImageScene.
Every method in this class is used to handle the different functionalities on the SearchImageScene.
The class implements Initializable
The @FXML tells the compiler that this variable is connected to an FXML-file

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initialize-method where the image-ArrayList with images from the database are filled in, and the ScrollPane is filled with all the SearchListItems.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the URL used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known
      resourceBundle - the ResourceBundle used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized

    • setListItems

      private void setListItems()
      Method where we go through all the images and creates a SearchListItem object with them and adds them to the corresponding lists.

    • handleSearchButtonClicked

      public void handleSearchButtonClicked()
      Handles the search button clicked. Goes through all input-fields and checks whether they are empty or not. Uses streams to filter through each criteria. At the end the ScrollPane is reloaded with all the search-results, and all input-fields are cleared.

    • checkIfImageContainsSameTags

      private boolean checkIfImageContainsSameTags​(ImageV2 imageV2)
      A for loop that checks if the image contains any tags from the search field
      Parameters:
      imageV2 - the image that is checked
      Returns:
      true or false

    • convertDateFormat

      private java.util.Date convertDateFormat​(java.time.LocalDate date)
      Method for converting LocalDate to Date
      Parameters:
      date - the date that is converted
      Returns:
      the date as a Date-object

    • checkIfDateIsInBetween

      private boolean checkIfDateIsInBetween​(java.util.Date fromDate, java.util.Date toDate, java.util.Date betweenDate)
      Method for checking if a date is between two dates.
      Parameters:
      fromDate - the first date
      toDate - the last date
      betweenDate - the date between the first and the last
      Returns:
      true or false

    • refreshList

      private void refreshList​(java.util.ArrayList<ImageV2> filteredImages)
      Method for refreshing the list when the search has been done
      Parameters:
      filteredImages - a list of images that will be refreshed

    • handleBackButtonClicked

      public void handleBackButtonClicked()
      A method for handling the BackButton.
      Sends you back to MainScene.

    • handleResetSearchButtonClicked

      public void handleResetSearchButtonClicked()
      A method for handling the SearchButton
      Clears any search inputs and refreshes the images

      A method for handling the AddTagButton

      Method for clearing all search inputs

    • collectAllSelectedImages

      private java.util.ArrayList<ImageV2> collectAllSelectedImages()
      Goes through all the SearchListItems-objects and checks if the checkbox is checked, and adds them to the list of selected images if so.
      Returns:
      the images that were selected

    • handleCreateButtonClicked

      public void handleCreateButtonClicked()
      Method for handling the CreateButton
      Opens a dialog where the user enters the name of the new album. After that we go through all selected images and adds them to the new album.

    • handleGeneratePDFButtonClicked

      public void handleGeneratePDFButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      Method for handling GeneratePFDButton
      Generates a pdf based on selected images
      IMPORTANT: Access to directory needs to be public, if a FileNotFoundException will be thrown
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - the exception that is thrown
